name: Ticket to Ride® The Board Game

editorialNotes.standard: Cool features like asynchronous multiplayer uplift the mobile version of this hit tabletop word association game.
Awesome reaction emoji! Strategy-smashing Nope cards! The fur truly flies in this slick adaptation of the zany card game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: This party game is the bomb!

ios.subtitle: Guess the word with video chat
A dice roller on your wrist.

editorialNotes.short: A dice roller on your wrist
editorialNotes.tagline: A dice roller on your wrist

editorialNotes.standard: Form smart alliances to keep the spice flowing in this superb digital reimagining of the popular board game.

Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and sound—and a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, it’s surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.

editorialNotes.tagline: Get a job and have kids with a spin

editorialNotes.standard: Sewing patterns on quilts so adorable kitties will curl up on them for a nap? Board games don’t get much cozier than this.
Blanket the Pacific Northwest with wildlife, rivers, mountains, and forests in this mellow board game that’s fun solo or online.

ios.subtitle: The family game of your life!

name: Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldn’t be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuro’s tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfully—and beautifully—the experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.

name: THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip

editorialNotes.tagline: Twist on a classic board game

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Expand your empire’s power by contending with Bronze Age civilizations in this sharp, streamlined strategy game.
Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital reimagining of the popular board game.

What’s made OLO game one of our multiplayer favorites since 2012? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for points—and slyly knocking an opponent’s discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennep’s all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.

ios.subtitle: Learn in 30 sec, play for life

editorialNotes.standard: Noodles is the kind of game that can completely flummox us for minutes at a time. And then, one second later, the entire puzzle reveals itself. It’s never very easy, but the overwhelming sense of accomplishment we get when we solve a puzzle makes it all worth it.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
